data: Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the powerplan (NOT required for direct admit patients)
Complete Admission or Transfer Medication Reconciliation
1 - No CPR, Supportive Care, No Intubation
2- No CPR, Therapeutic Care, No Intubation
3 - No CPR, Acute Transfer, No Intubation
4 - No CPR, Critical Care, No Intubation
5 - No CPR, Critical Care, May Intubate
VAD vital signs q1h until hemodynamically stable, then QID PRN
MAP goal: 50 to 85 mmHg or greater,SpO2 goal: 92% or greater, Hgb Goal: 75 g/L or greater. Special Instructions: maintain Cardiac Index above 2.0
Immobilize VAD percutaneous lines with stabilization device immediately post-op
If LVAD/RVAD alarms due to high wattage or low flows
RASS goal of -5, Unrousable, RASS goal start at -5, wean sedation to meet goal of RASS 0
Site: VAD exit site dressing, q daily
Apply heal protectors / pressure relieving boots
Order ArjoHuntleigh Therapulse ATP bed for patients intubated longer than 48 hours
Tube to Low Continuous Suction, insert large bore
Tube to Low Continuous Suction, insert large bore
Progress as tolerated, supine, side to side, elevate head of bed, sitting, dangle, stand
T+1;0830, Start Clear Fluid Diet, Advance to Regular Diet, no salt packages, RN or RD to place subsequent diet order
T+1;0830, Start Clear Fluid Diet, Advance to Diabetic Diet, RN or RD to place subsequent diet order

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)

Urgent, Reason: CSICU Admission, Transport:Portable, Portable Reason: Requires constant monitoring/observation
Vt 6 to 10 mL/kg, PEEP 5 to 15 cm H2O, Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater, RR below 25
Consider consultation with Endocrinology, Nephrology, and Psychiatry
